summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. It details the status of document releases, reasons for postponements, and specific information about Cecelia T. Morton, including her employment history, resignation, and resume. Additionally, it covers payroll authorization forms and memoranda regarding secretarial staff hiring and payroll certification requirements.
key_findings: Partial postponement of the document was due to the inclusion of Social Security numbers, with redactions implemented to safeguard personal privacy.
Cecelia T. Morton was employed as a secretary for the HSCA's Kennedy Unit in 1977 but resigned soon after accepting a more substantial job offer.
The document offers a glimpse into the HSCA's administrative and payroll procedures, particularly the management of sensitive personal information.
Detailed employment records and resumes within the document highlight the professional backgrounds of staff members.
